page.description: Functions to convert other data types to strings.

item.name: [*HTML_ESCAPE()]
item.description: Encodes ordinary text into HTML format.

item.name: [A5_RFC1123DATE()]
item.description: Takes a date, either as a time or character, and converts it to a string following the RFC 1123 format.

item.name: [A5_RFC822DATE()]
item.description: Takes a date, either as a time or character, and converts it to a string, following the RFC 822 format.

item.name: [A5_RFC850DATE()]
item.description: Takes a date, either as a time or character, and converts it to a string, following the RFC 850 format.

item.name: [A5_T_FROM_RFCDATE()]
item.description: Converts a date string formatted by A5_ANSIDATE(), A5_RFC1123DATE(), A5_RFC822DATE(), or A5_RFC850DATE() into a time-date value.

item.name: [CDATE()]
item.description: Converts a date to a formatted character string in the form YYYYMMDD.

item.name: [CDOW()]
item.description: Returns a character string containing the name of the day of the week for the specified date.

item.name: [CMONTH()]
item.description: Returns the name of the month for the specified date.

item.name: [CHAR_TO_BLOB()]
item.description: Returns the blob equivalent of a character string.

item.name: [CONVERT_TYPE()]
item.description: Converts variables from one type to another, preserving the data if possible.

item.name: [CTOD()]
item.description: Converts a character string containing date information to a Date value.

item.name: [CTODT()]
item.description: Converts a date and time string to a time value.

item.name: [CTOT()]
item.description: Converts a time string to a time value.

item.name: [CYEAR()]
item.description: Returns a character string containing the year in the form YYYY based on the specified date value.

item.name: [TIME()]
item.description: Returns a formatted string containing the system time.

item.name: [split()]
item.description: Splits a character strings into multiple sub strings and stores them in an array.

item.name: [TOTIME()]
item.description: Returns a formatted character string containing a time based on the specified number of seconds past midnight.
